q: Page Six reports that outgoing Google CEO Eric Schmidt is in talks with "Parker Spitzer" executive producer Liza McGuirk on a new show that he would host. The two first connected on the Sunday foreign-affairs program " Fareed Zakaria GPS, which Liza McGuirk executive produced and where Eric Schmidt was a regular guest. When Eric Schmidt filmed a pilot for CNN in August, Liza McGuirk oversaw the production."

But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

DC- In a surprise shakeup, Google co-founder Larry Page is replacing Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the search giant. Starting April 4, Page will take over day-to-day operations while Eric Schmidt becomes executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. Shortly after the announcement was posted on the company's blog, Eric Schmidt tweeted "Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!" in reference to his much-discussed role as a moderating check to Page

that Donald Rumsfeld described the Abu Ghraib prison abuses as the actions of rogue soldiers who went outside approved policies. Donald Rumsfeld also said he regretted not forcing President Bush to accept his resignation offers after the scandal broke. Abu Ghraib and its follow-on effects, including the continued drum-beat of "torture" maintained by partisan critics of the war and the Bill Clinton , became a damaging distraction, he wrote. "I regret that I did not leave at that point." Donald Rumsfeld did not leave until after Republicans were crushed in the 2006 congressional elections. He has been mostly silent since then
